questions.question: 1. At which pH value was the solubility of the protein powder lowest?
2. Which of the following best describes the insoluble matter (IM) in the experiment?
3. What is the significance of the solubility curve obtained in the experiment?

answers.a: It shows the optimal pH for protein extraction
answers.b: It identifies the temperature range for protein solubility
answers.c: It demonstrates the relationship between pH and protein solubility
answers.d: It shows the rate of protein degradation

questions.question: 4. What would likely happen if the pH of the buffer solution were adjusted to the protein's isoelectric point?

answers.b: Protein would precipitate and become insoluble
answers.c: Protein would degrade into smaller peptides
answers.d: There would be no change in solubility

questions.question: 5. What is the purpose of drying the filter paper and protein in the oven?

answers.b: To remove the moisture content and measure the dry weight of insoluble matter
answers.d: To convert the insoluble matter into a soluble form
